35232142: Flooding in Dumfries and Galloway, particularly in Newton Stewart, has caused significant damage, with many businesses and households affected, prompting calls for improved flood protection measures.
40143035: A fire at a Holiday Inn in Northern Ireland destroyed two buses carrying tourists from Germany, China, and Taiwan, with police investigating a possible deliberate attack.
35951548: Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton secured pole position ahead of Sebastian Vettel and Kimi Raikkonen, with the team looking strong for the race despite Ferrari's initial challenge.
36266422: A 67-year-old former scout leader, John Bates, faces 22 charges of indecency with a child, denying all allegations made by four male complainants between 1972 and 1989.
38826984: A man receiving psychiatric treatment at a hospital in Istanbul threatened to shoot himself and others, prompting an evacuation and police negotiation.
34540833: Glasgow Warriors secured a crucial win over the Dragons with a late try from Simone Favaro, following earlier touchdowns by Chris Fusaro and Zander Fagerson.
20836172: A 31-year-old woman, Veronica Chango-Alverez, was killed and another man injured in a car crash in Streatham High Road, London, on Saturday morning.
35932467: Belgian cyclist Demoitie, 25, died after a collision with a motorbike during the Gent-Wevelgem race, prompting calls for improved safety measures in road racing.
40758845: Manchester City midfielder Ilkay Gundogan says he can see the end of his recovery from a knee injury but won't rush his return to the Premier League season.
30358490: A man in his 20s was involved in a car crash in Leigh-on-Sea, Essex, and airlifted to hospital with head injuries and suspected multiple fractures.
34615665: Hurricane Patricia, the highest rating a tropical storm can get, hit mainland Mexico, marking the first time a storm of this magnitude has hit the country since 1959.
35890902: Security firm Bastille Networks reveals that many wireless mice are vulnerable to spoofing due to unencrypted radio signals, allowing attackers to control computers remotely.
37922330: Murray and Burrell, a 95-year-old building firm, has gone into administration, resulting in 38 job losses, with some workers potentially finding new employment at a nearby construction company.
30844962: The European Commission has raised doubts about Luxembourg's tax arrangement with Amazon, potentially classifying it as state aid, amid concerns over tax avoidance and compliance with EU rules.
36217333: The Balmoral Show, a three-day agricultural event in Northern Ireland, celebrates farming, food, and family fun with local produce, livestock, and entertainment.
30816523: Former News of the World subject Jimmy Mosley sues Google over publication of private photos from a sex party, claiming breaches of the Data Protection Act and misuse of private information.
38900884: Bath Rugby player Eddie Jackson has suffered a season-ending injury, but coaches see it as an opportunity for other players to step up and fill the void.
13890581: The Cornish Language Partnership has secured a three-year funding package to help preserve the Cornish language, which is considered critically endangered with fewer than 500 fluent speakers worldwide.
40194700: AS Monaco's Leonardo Jardim described the club's 2016-17 season as "exceptional" after leading the team to the French championship title and Champions League semi-finals.
37903647: The Nicaraguan government's election, in which Daniel Ortega won 72.5% of the vote, was widely criticized as flawed and undemocratic by the US State Department.
13291223: South Africa's government announces a task team to address "corrective rape," a form of hate crime targeting lesbians, following widespread protests and a petition signed by 170,000 activists.
36052570: Big oil-producing nations meet in Qatar to discuss a potential oil production freeze, amid a global economic downturn and declining energy stocks.
34944735: A study by US biologists finds that the vibrant blue color in 40 out of 53 tarantula species likely evolved independently at least eight times, suggesting a strong visual signalling function.
32159602: Germanwings co-pilot Andreas Lubitz, 27, intentionally crashed Flight 9525, killing all 150 people on board, after researching ways to commit suicide and cockpit security on a tablet computer.
34988915: Former radio DJ Mr Fox denies eight counts of indecent assault and two counts of sexual assault against female colleagues and a 15-year-old fan between 1988 and 2014.
37889203: England midfielder Dele Alli will be out for a few weeks after twisting his knee in a clash with a teammate, missing upcoming matches against Scotland and Spain.
33609927: A Jehovah's Witnesses elder, who sexually abused two women, including a teenager, was only brought to justice after 20 years, highlighting the organisation's internal handling of child abuse cases.
33578778: Greece is set to receive an €86bn bailout in exchange for austerity measures, with Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras facing criticism for his decision to sign the deal despite doubts about its success.
36888270: The International Paralympic Committee (IPC) has opened proceedings against Russia's National Paralympic Committee over a widespread doping programme, with a decision due in August.
36846007: Former England under-20 international Ben joins Exiles on undisclosed contract, bringing Championship experience to the north London side ahead of a competitive campaign.
31723471: Manor Marussia, a Formula 1 team, has secured investment from Stephen Fitzpatrick and appointed Justin King as interim chairman, aiming to become competitive at the highest level.
15921828: The Welsh government has agreed on a £38.9m stimulus package to boost the economy, with projects including apprenticeships, school upgrades, and road improvements.
39109408: Former UK Prime Minister John Major urges the government to adopt a more diplomatic approach in Brexit negotiations, warning of substantial costs and a diminished diplomatic force.
20936833: The UK government is set to cap benefit rises at 1% for three years, sparking debate over who will feel the pain, with Labour arguing it will hit working families.
36832879: A hole in a sewer under a railway track in Forest Hill has caused disruptions to Southern, Thameslink, and London Overground services until Wednesday.
14958201: Manchester City edged past Everton 2-0 with Mario Balotelli scoring the decisive goal and James Milner adding the second in the second half to move City to the top of the Premier League.
34352262: Nicola Sturgeon claims Scotland has met its six-week target for delayed hospital discharges, but Labour disputes the claim, citing statistics showing thousands of patients waited longer than six weeks.
39805395: The European Court of Justice ruled that the UK's use of overflow pipes to stop flooding in a Welsh conservation area broke clean water laws, prompting investments in improvements.
34303109: Pope Francis arrives in Cuba, hailed as a key figure in improving ties between the US and Cuba, and will spend four days in the country before traveling to the US.
39939090: Former England playmaker Rangi Chase joins bottom-of-the-table Widnes on a season-long deal after being dropped by Castleford.
29347771: Cricket Scotland's chief executive, Roddy Smith, is stepping down after 10 years, leaving the organization in good health with a growing game and a strong future ahead.
36783415: Sunderland's Premier League club wants former manager Sam Allardyce to stay, amid speculation about his potential England job, which England is searching for after Roy Hodgson's resignation.
37935687: Wales edged Argentina 32-28 in a closely contested match, with Leigh Halfpenny's 78th-minute penalty securing a four-point victory for the Welsh team.
40260829: New Zealand troops stationed in England have had two monuments, the Bulford Kiwi and a Terrain Model of Messines, granted protection as scheduled monuments by Historic England.
36478199: Two inmates at HMP Wayland were transferred to a higher security jail after attempting to steal keys from officers during an incident on A wing on May 27.
34541803: Former Blackburn Rovers player Chris Sutton defends Tim Sherwood, Villa's manager, saying he has the leadership qualities and knowledge to succeed despite the team's struggles.
35360841: The Welsh government is launching a consultation on new guidelines to tackle abuse in child care, amid a rise in rejections by local authorities.
35550407: Life expectancy among 65-year-olds in England rose to its highest level in 2014, with men expected to live for 19 more years and women for 21 more years.
37561590: Nottinghamshire Police's Operation Equinox is investigating historical abuse claims, with 530 of 636 reported crimes on council property, and 283 suspects identified so far.
39328843: The Women's FA Cup last eight draw has been announced, with the quarter-final ties set to take place on Sunday, featuring top-flight teams and prize money of £4,000 for winners.
35389665: Cheltenham Town secured their seventh win in eight in the National League with a 3-1 victory over Bromley, thanks to goals from Holman and Wright.
33080187: An electrician from Brazil, mistakenly identified as a suicide bomber, was fatally shot by police at London's Stockwell Tube station in 2005, sparking widespread outrage and a long-running investigation.
38636995: Glasgow City Council plans to raise Council Tax by 3% to support frontline services and protect vulnerable residents, despite a £67m budget gap.
18536236: Sustainable Shetland plans to seek a judicial review of the Scottish government's decision to approve a 370MW wind farm, citing concerns over its size and impact on the landscape.
36289151: Uganda's President Yoweri Museveni won a landslide victory in the general election, but opposition leader Kizza Besigye was charged with treason after appearing in court.
23017045: The Lions secured a 23-21 win in Brisbane, with North scoring his first Test try, despite Australia's late penalty attempts and a disputed try attempt by North.
36418082: Germany's national soccer team has named its 23-man squad for the European Championship, with several injured players, including Marco Reus and Bastian Schweinsteiger, included despite health concerns.
34396551: Prosecutors accuse Fifa president Sepp Blatter of making a "disloyal payment" of $2m to Uefa president Michel Platini, who denies any wrongdoing.
39720944: World number six Ronnie Higgins reached the semi-finals for the first time since 2011 with a 13-6 win over Kyren Wilson, setting up a potential final against Stephen Maguire.
35884842: A former soldier, Pte Paul Wilkinson, testifies at an inquest into the 1995 death of Pte Cheryl James, who was found with a bullet wound to the head at a military base.
35403375: A 57-year-old US citizen, Doug Richard, denies paying a 13-year-old girl and her 15-year-old friend for sex, claiming the encounter was consensual and he "reasonably believed" the girl was over 16.
26341324: Eleven telecommunication cables were vandalized in Ealing, affecting thousands of people in London and parts of the South East, with most services now restored.
19212345: Caster Semenya, a 21-year-old South African, is a contender for the women's 800m final, with coach Vivian Mutola predicting a competitive and tactical race.
30548367: SXSW organisers face lawsuits over safety lapses after a car crashed through a barrier at the music festival, killing four and injuring 23 people, including a Dutch music executive.
37919402: Mills and Clark win Olympic gold in the women's 470 event in Rio, marking a culmination of their six-year team effort and childhood dreams.
39995133: Germany's 33-year-old foil fencer Maximilian Kruse wins the Shanghai tournament, beating Italy's Alessio Foconi 15-8 to rise to world number five.
40249088: Ineos plans to expand its production units in Scotland and Norway, creating 300 new jobs and increasing ethylene production by 50% to support its European businesses.
40254388: Uber's board unanimously adopted all recommendations from a report by former US Attorney-General Eric Holder on the company's culture and practices, amid ongoing issues with sexual harassment and leadership.
31995230: English Heritage has approved the replacement of Charminster bridge with a new one featuring larger arches, preserving its historic character and using original bricks whenever possible.
38632129: Chelsea strengthen their Premier League title position with a 3-0 win at Leicester City, while Manchester City's title hopes are all but over as they face a fight for the top four.
35720795: Scottish footballer McGregor is fined £500 and disqualified for 12 months after being caught driving erratically with an alcohol reading of 78mg in Glasgow.
23906759: Dan Evans, ranked 179th, lost to Feliciano Robredo in a thrilling US Open match, earning £60,000 in prize money and closing in on the world's top 150.
19410108: The Supreme Court's decision to uphold the death penalty of Pakistani national Mohammad Ajmal Amir Qasab has reignited debate over the use of capital punishment in India.
30745137: A Singapore-registered vehicle transporter, the Hoegh Osaka, is being pumped of water and oil after it ran aground off the coast of the UK, with salvage operations ongoing.
26553115: Researchers discover water trapped in deep Earth rocks, potentially holding as much water as all the oceans, in a diamond from central-west Brazil.
37872311: UKIP leader Nigel Farage returns as interim leader after his successor Diane James quit, with Paul Nuttall and Peter Whittle remaining in the contest for the permanent position.
35553131: Aberdeen-born artist has been awarded the RSGS's Livingstone Medal for raising awareness of the global HIV/AIDS pandemic, a historic honor first given in 1901.
39038936: News organisations sue FBI to learn about circumstances surrounding unlocking of Syed Rizwan Farook's iPhone, citing lack of justification and national security concerns.
38735486: New Zealand-born rugby coach Vern Cotter is set to leave Scotland after the Six Nations, citing a desire to return to France and a new coaching opportunity, but credits Scotland with helping him understand the country and its people.
17087845: A fire at Honduras' Comayagua prison has killed 358 people, mostly inmates, with forensic experts working to identify the victims through DNA testing and investigating the cause of the blaze.
37443011: The Willow Tea Rooms Trust is refurbishing the 1903 Sauchiehall Street building, recreating the original tea room inside the nearby Watt Brothers store.
36855749: Michelle Obama surprised guests on The Late Late Show by singing along to hits by Beyonce, Stevie Wonder, and Missy Elliott during a karaoke session.
35613141: England lost the second Twenty20 international to South Africa by eight wickets, despite Jos Buttler's 32 not out, after a promising start from Alex Hales and Joe Root.
39088847: The UK government is introducing new rules to clarify eligibility criteria for Personal Independence Payments, sparking concerns over cuts to disability benefits affecting 160,000 people.
33197277: Simon Cowell and Cheryl Fernandez-Versini will return as judges for this year's X Factor, with new presenters Olly Murs and Caroline Flack and judges Nick Grimshaw and Rita Ora.
33815489: William Hill's pre-tax profits fell 35% to £78.7m in the first six months of the year due to increased taxes and costs.
35862754: The Vikings have finished at the top of the Super League table after seven games, thanks to their strong forwards and improved defensive side.
36080615: The Great Barrier Reef is experiencing its worst coral bleaching event on record, with 7% of the reef showing no signs of bleaching, threatening its survival due to climate change.
22822742: Manchester United has signed 20-year-old defender Rafael Varela to a five-year deal, marking David Moyes's first signing as the club's manager.
39747536: Granada CF suffered a 1-1 draw with Real Sociedad, ending their six-season spell in the top flight, as Carlos Vela and Juanmi scored for the hosts.
34218396: A Mumbai court is set to pronounce sentences on 12 men accused of masterminding the 2006 serial bombings that killed 189 people and injured over 800 in the city.
39150388: A new study by Cancer Research UK found that over a third of Scots eat confectionary daily, linking it to a significant risk of preventable cancer and obesity.
28765782: Wisconsin Governor Scott Walker declares August 13 "Purple Hearts for Healing" Day for a 12-year-old girl stabbed 19 times by two girls inspired by the fictional character Slenderman.
35828022: Greek coach Skafidas admitted nine rule violations, including abusing trust with sprinter Wilson, and was banned from coaching for four years.
27717735: The Scottish capital's trams have finally begun running after six years of disruption, with a judge-led public inquiry to be held to investigate the project's significant cost overruns and delays.
37977826: MotoGP rider Valentino Rossi apologizes for colliding with a fan while riding a motorcycle at the Valencia Grand Prix, sparking a potential investigation and bruise on the fan's leg.
31768588: Edinburgh's rugby player, Kennedy, is expected to be sidelined for up to six months due to a shoulder complaint that required surgery.
37183351: North Cumbria University Hospitals NHS Trust considers removing consultant-led maternity services from Whitehaven due to concerns over safety and infrastructure, sparking a public consultation.
39622090: Rangers manager Pedro Caixinha's team is looking to upset Celtic's 33-point league lead in the Scottish Cup semi-final, with Lovenkrands urging his former team to win at all costs.
39272756: The PSNI will close shops from 4pm-9pm on March 17 to help keep people safe after disturbances in the area on St Patrick's Day in 2016.
32138822: South Wales Police are investigating a robbery at a Lloyds Bank in Canton, Cardiff, after a suspect was caught on CCTV cameras and is being sought by police.
31070114: The UK Army is creating a new 77th Brigade unit, inspired by World War Two's Chindits, to operate "smarter" and adapt to modern asymmetric warfare, with a focus on non-traditional capabilities.
39652762: A 33-year-old man, Garry Allen, has been charged with causing death by dangerous driving after a fatal car crash in Bottesford, Derbyshire, on May 25, 2016.
33258866: A 32-year-old woman, Sarah Sands, denies murdering her 77-year-old neighbour Michael Pleasted, who was awaiting trial for alleged child sex abuse, after a fatal stabbing in November.
36962388: Human Rights Watch and Amnesty International released a report criticizing conditions at a Nauru detention centre, alleging intentional abuse and mistreatment of asylum seekers.
32282272: The Welsh election campaign is centered around health issues, with the main parties debating NHS spending, privatization, and investment in rural healthcare services.
36093072: A beach hut in Abersoch, Wales, sold for a record-breaking £70,000, despite being small and in need of repair, to two determined bidders from the Cheshire area.
38879972: A third-party website was used to provide information on the 2017 FIFA Women's World Cup, but it was not officially endorsed by FIFA or EA Sports.
32106473: The council's use of railings to display parking signs in a Grade II* listed conservation area has raised concerns about potential cumulative impact on the area's historic character.
40415815: Rescuers were hindered by the Siresp emergency services network's failures during Portugal's worst forest fires, which killed 64 people and injured 254.
34581918: Fifa's presidential election will determine the successor to Sepp Blatter, who has been suspended amid corruption allegations, with several candidates vying for the position.
33004157: Ireland's first automated traffic enforcement system has been introduced at the Blackhall Place-Benburb Street Luas junction to reduce collisions between trams and vehicles.
30334943: An 18-year-old man dressed as a superhero was charged with trespassing after entering the Stadium of Light during a Manchester City vs Sunderland football match.
33280503: Queen Elizabeth II visited Bergen-Belsen concentration camp, where thousands died, and met survivors and liberators, paying respects to the victims and reflecting on the horrors of World War Two.
25726782: Dumfries and Galloway Council is investing almost £2.5m to redevelop the harbour as a marina complex and regenerate the town after Stena Line moved its operations.
35479854: Aston Villa manager Unai Garde's future is uncertain after a 3-0 loss to West Ham, with Garde hinting at a possible reassessment of his position in the summer.
32716226: A Wisconsin police officer, Matt Kenny, will not face charges for fatally shooting an unarmed 19-year-old, Tony Robinson Jr, who was involved in a confrontation with Kenny.
37047554: The UK government has named and shamed 198 firms, including football clubs and care homes, for failing to pay the minimum wage, with total arrears of over £3.5m.
36565290: The M4 motorway in Wales will be closed for maintenance work, mainly at night, until February 2018, with diversions in place for through traffic and local access.
27758640: Thousands of Lyssa Zampa tropical moths, also known as the Laos brown butterfly, were spotted in Singapore and Malaysia, sparking debate over their harmless presence.
28897118: A study reveals that only 25 Madagascar pochard ducks remain in the wild, with 96% of chicks dying at two to three weeks old due to insufficient food in their habitat.
38452661: Ireland's national cricket team will participate in a week-long round-robin tournament in the UAE, featuring eight associate countries, from January 17 to 20.
38033492: Hywel Dda University Health Board plans to reduce the hours of its paediatric ambulatory care unit at Withybush Hospital by four hours a day due to consultant shortages.
35949555: Stirling Binos and Stirling City played a closely contested match, with several close calls and saves, but neither team could find the back of the net.
15263826: Kazakhstan, a vast and ethnically diverse country, has experienced rapid economic growth since independence in 1991, but its authoritarian government has faced criticism for suppressing dissent and limiting media freedom.
37313866: Several British athletes, including Paralympic medallists, face challenges in their respective events on the second day of the Games, with some expressing hopes to improve their performances.
13911157: Wimbledon completes the signing of centre-half Mitchel-King, a former Histon player, after releasing him from Crewe, with contract options also taken up for Luke Moore and Fraser Franks.
39594894: Arlene Foster has agreed to meet with Irish language speakers to discuss the Irish Language Act, a key priority for Sinn Féin in the power-sharing talks at Stormont.
34096170: Scottish attacking midfielder John Maloney has signed a two-year deal with Hull City after leaving Chicago Fire, citing a desire to return to British football and play for his national team.
37891952: British speed skater Charlotte Christie wins a gold medal in the 3000m event at the Calgary World Cup, beating her previous Sochi 2014 disqualifications.
40186158: Four British sailors died when their yacht, Cheeki Rafiki, capsized in the North Atlantic in 2014 due to a faulty keel, with the yacht manager accused of gross negligence.
37049719: Swansea City signs 23-year-old striker Borja from Atletico Madrid for a club record fee of £15m, with the goal of making a good impression and potentially earning a national call-up.
34610504: Sporting Khalsa, a semi-professional Asian club from the West Midlands, faces a daunting task against FC United of Manchester in the FA Cup fourth qualifying round, with over 2,000 supporters expected at the Aspray Arena.
37595429: A 45-year-old man was arrested in Greater Manchester's Orthodox Jewish community on Rosh Hashanah for a racially aggravated offence and possessing an offensive weapon, released on bail.
29772670: Labour leader Johann Lamont resigns, citing a need for a "real discussion" about the party's future in Scotland, amid criticism from Westminster colleagues.
36369872: French social media users are jokingly renaming films to reflect the country's fuel shortage, with titles such as Pump Friction and 0 Mile.
34527433: Bank of America and Wells Fargo report mixed quarterly results, with Bank of America's profits rising 5% and Wells Fargo seeing a 0.65% increase in net income to $5.44bn.
31111734: A BBC documentary, Mr Alzheimers and Me, explores the experiences of three young people living with grandparents who have dementia, sharing their personal stories and struggles.
40303872: Campbell Baird rescued a cat named Francee from a tiny cavity space in the wall of his new home after hearing her meowing and posting a video on Facebook to find her owner.
33653553: Shamsul Arefin was found guilty of modern-day slavery after recruiting four men from Bangladesh to work at his hotel in Scotland, exploiting them for substantial sums of money.
34404510: London Paramount resort, a 900-acre water park with 5,000 hotel rooms, may open in 2021 after developers delay submission for development consent order due to research.
35568692: Russia denies hitting civilian targets in Syria, despite claims from observers that at least 1,015 civilians have been killed in Russian air strikes.
39151664: Leyton Orient, owned by Italian investor Becchetti, faces a winding-up petition for unpaid tax, prompting fans to consider a last-resort measure to save the relegation-threatened club.
37493670: Moby releases a new, fast and aggressive post-punk record, "The Systems Are Failing," after feeling liberated from commercial pressures and wanting to make music that excites him.
21935983: Researchers at Cardiff University found students with the Welsh Baccalaureate were 15% less likely to achieve a first or 2:1 degree, despite being more likely to get into university.
38174214: Tiger Woods, a 14-time major champion, shot a 72 in the first round of his charity event, nine shots behind leader JB Holmes, despite a solid start and four birdies.
40319923: A 38-year-old man, Shaun Murphy, has died in hospital after being found injured in Wythenshawe, with a 23-year-old man in custody for questioning.
36478264: Austria's Freedom Party leader Heinz Christian Strache has filed a challenge to the election result, alleging numerous irregularities, including postal vote handling and underage voting.
11935769: Jersey's report suggests splitting the role of head of the legal system and president of the States, citing concerns over clarity and potential conflicts of interest.
33373410: Rebels launched a coordinated assault on government-held areas in Aleppo, Syria, with the aim of liberating the city and its countryside, marking the most serious offensive since the battle for Aleppo began.
11130680: The 58-year-old director, daughter of Italian film director Roberto Rossellini and Ingrid Bergman, is set to showcase her directorial debut at the 2011 Berlin Film Festival.
34868650: The US government says three American citizens were detained by Houthi rebels in Yemen's capital, Sanaa, on suspicion of spying, prompting a request for Oman's help.
33960561: Inmarsat's Global Xpress platform, a £1bn satellite network, is set to launch on a Russian Proton rocket on August 28, after a delay caused by the rocket's previous failure.
22504858: Fernando Alonso won the Malaysian Grand Prix, his second victory of the year, to move into third place in the standings behind Sebastian Vettel.
32283530: A high-speed crash in Shanghai's tunnel injured one person and damaged two luxury cars, a Lamborghini and a Ferrari, amid speculation about the drivers' backgrounds and possible involvement in drag racing.
38377099: UK stocks rose, with Carnival, Lloyds, Barclays, and Prudential seeing significant gains, while the pound fell against the dollar and euro in currency markets.
36105123: British athletes Oates, Davis, and McKenzie lost in their respective matches at the competition, with Oates and McKenzie falling short in the semi-finals and finals.
33527826: Buccleuch Estates and partners plan to develop a 100MW pumped storage hydro scheme at Glenmuckloch, potentially generating power for over a century.
32349891: The UK general election is expected to be highly unpredictable, with regional and local factors potentially leading to unexpected gains and losses for established parties.
34281974: East Sussex Healthcare Trust, which runs two hospitals, is likely to be placed into special measures after failing to improve despite being rated "inadequate" by the Care Quality Commission.
29387866: Conservative leader David Cameron pledges to build 100,000 new homes for young people under 40, exempt from taxes and sold at 20% less than market value.
35731925: The UK Parliament is set to face several key debates, including a clash over Sunday trading restrictions, a new crime bill, and a report stage on the Immigration Bill, with votes expected on various amendments.
38829733: A former pupil of Haggerston Girls' School in Hackney, east London, claims the school's music room may have exposed her to asbestos, potentially causing her mesothelioma.
24624736: Ulster rugby player Chris Henry has signed a contract extension, committing to the team until at least 2017, to pursue his ambitions with both Ulster and Ireland.
36928562: Northern Ireland's Rory McIlroy missed the cut by one stroke after a one-under 69, while Henrik Stenson and Emiliano Grillo are tied for the lead at six under.
34941119: AirAsia posts a net loss of $95.8 million due to foreign exchange and Indonesian operations, but aims to improve in the fourth quarter with increased capacity.
30206231: The UK government's new Counter-Terrorism and Security Bill has been criticized by David Anderson QC, who questions the role of courts in implementing temporary exclusion orders and the potential erosion of civil liberties.
35584972: Hundreds of JNU students protest the arrest of student union leader Kanhaiya Kumar, calling him innocent and condemning the police action as an attempt to suppress free speech.
39277709: New Zealand cricketer Tim Ronchi joins the Pakistan Super League, replacing Sharjeel Khan, and is set to play in all 14 T20 group games.
36123657: Police investigated an incident on Glen Road in the early hours of Sunday, but found nothing and the road has since reopened.
33363938: A breaking news story is being updated, and readers can receive alerts via email or the BBC News App for the latest updates on the story.
37349129: The Singapore Grand Prix is a highly desirable and exceptional event, combining a unique ambience, challenging track, and delicious local food, making it a must-attend for F1 fans.
37160199: A Northern Ireland man claims his DNR order was placed on his medical file without his consent, sparking concerns about patient autonomy and medical ethics.
35891053: Northern Ireland's First Minister Arlene Foster and Deputy First Minister Martin McGuinness met in Enniskillen to promote the region and engage with local people.
40694542: Manchester United's Wilfried Zaha responds to racist abuse by saying fans can continue to insult him if it makes their day better after a 2-0 win over West Brom.
24645770: Labour wins Dunfermline by-election with a majority of 2,873, marking a significant swing from the SNP and sending a message to the Scottish government to focus on local priorities.
37974587: Liam McDonald, 31, succeeds Marcus Bignot as Solihull's head coach, aiming to put his stamp on the team and build on the progress made by his predecessor.
40354149: The BBC is inviting the public to submit their photographs of Scotland, with a deadline for submissions between June 16 and June 23.
35519470: The UK police are considering using birds of prey, such as eagles, to take down drones, following a successful Dutch trial, but experts have raised concerns about the safety and welfare of the birds.
36185624: Oyster farming in Porlock Bay has become a successful venture after a 2013 trial, with plans to sell 500,000 oysters annually and expand to 500 trestles in the next few years.
39306113: Wales coach Rob Howley has been criticized for failing to bring new players into the team, with captain Alun Wyn Jones defending his decision to stick with the same side.
19347718: Dudley Council and the Black Country Reinvestment Society launch a £10,000 to £50,000 loan scheme to support local businesses with fewer than 250 staff.
21870064: A proposed Arizona bill would make it a misdemeanor to use public facilities associated with a gender other than one's birth certificate, sparking concerns about transgender rights.
37675776: Two men, Ronnie Frost and Joe Cordon, were arrested and charged with shining a light at a helicopter searching for a missing person in Northwood.
38107017: Gorka Marquez, a Strictly dancer, was attacked by a gang of youths in Blackpool, chipping two of his teeth, but doesn't plan to make a formal complaint.
40046472: Newington Church of England Primary School apologizes for not discussing a refugee scenario with parents or staff before presenting it to 4-11-year-old children during a Christian Aid fundraiser.
32157820: A 67-year-old man with disabilities was attacked and left with a broken collarbone, leading to a £330,135 online appeal, and the perpetrator was sentenced to four years in prison.
41004037: Canada is experiencing a surge in migrants from Haiti, with nearly 60,000 Haitians offered temporary protection in the US, and officials are working to counter misinformation about residency and asylum rules.
21387993: A University College London study found that many UK paediatricians lack knowledge on identifying underweight children and serious complications, despite experience with eating disorders.
34665539: China's Communist Party has announced a two-child policy, allowing couples to have more children to address the country's aging population and slow population growth rate.
37872111: Governments agree to keep global temperature rise to 2C, preferably 1.5C, as the Paris climate pact comes into force, with a review of national pledges showing they fall short of needed levels.
36629542: England's number one ranked Test bowler, James Anderson, is set to miss Lancashire's next two County Championship games due to a stress fracture in his right shoulder blade.
36487527: Julian Cuddihy, 43, was found guilty of murdering his parents Kathleen and Jimmy Cuddihy at their home in County Donegal in 2014 and will undergo long-term treatment.
37344756: Premier League and Championship football results saw several upsets, with Newcastle thrashing QPR 6-0 and Barnsley beating Wolves 4-0.
